intro: Kotschya africana var. ringoetii, commonly known as the African kotschya, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain minute seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
